**How To Apply**
 If you have questions about this assignment, you are welcome to contact Head of AI & Business Intelligence (Jakob.Liljedahl@coop.se).
   

  

 We will perform interview continuously so please apply in English with your CV, and some words why you feel you’re a good fit for this role at Coop.

title: Data Centre Technician - Stockholm
description:
CoreWeave is The Essential Cloud for AI™. Built for pioneers by pioneers, CoreWeave delivers a platform of technology, tools, and teams that enables innovators to build and scale AI with confidence. Trusted by leading AI labs, startups, and global enterprises, CoreWeave combines superior infrastructure performance with deep technical expertise to accelerate breakthroughs and turn compute into capability. Founded in 2017, CoreWeave became a publicly traded company (Nasdaq: CRWV) in March 2025. Learn more at www.coreweave.com.
   

  

 We're proud to be a Living Wage accredited Employer.
   

  

 We are seeking experienced Data Center Technicians to join our team in Stockholm.
   

  

**Location: This is a 100% on-site** 
 position at our Data Center in Stockholm. A relocation allowance is available for national and international candidates.
   

  

**Salary:** 
 490,000 SEK - 760,000 SEK per year. Relocation allowance is available for national and international candidates.
   

  

 The Data Center Technician must work well with others and will help ensure overall availability and reliability to meet or exceed defined service levels of data center operations. This position involves hardware and network diagnostics followed by physical repair and will include participation in an on-call rotation.
   

  

* Maintain data center operations to ensure the availability and reliability of service levels
* Conduct hardware and network diagnostics and repairs
* Root cause analysis of hardware and software failures
* Training of internal teams
* Development of documentation
* Provide technical support to data center teams
* Development of scripts to update server and networking hardware
* Maintain inventory
* Assemble and install equipment
* Perform maintenance of test and tool equipment
* Occasional travel to other data centers as needed


**Requirements**
* 3+ years of data centre experience
* Experience with Data Center buildout, assembling and installing equipment
* Computer hardware experience (troubleshooting, assembling)
* Linux operating system experience
* Ability to work in an environment that operates a shift pattern, with an ability to participate in on-call rotation and provide after-hours support as needed
* Excellent time management, organisational and communication skills
* Must be able to prioritise tasks and react quickly to issues
* Candidates should be able to lift up to 22kg and/or work in elevated locations
* Applicants must have work authorisation that does not require sponsorship from the company now or in the future.


**Nice Haves**
* Computer Networking experience
* Python, Bash or other scripting languages experience
* Experience with Cisco IOS and/or Juniper JunOS
* A degree or equivalent experience in an IT related field


*To fulfil our obligation to protect client data, successful applicants offered employment with CoreWeave will be required to complete a basic criminal record check, conducted in compliance with GDPR. Employment offers are conditional upon receiving satisfactory check results*
**What We Offer**
 In addition to a competitive salary, we offer a variety of benefits to support your needs, including:
   

  

* Family-level Medical Insurance
* Family-level Dental Insurance
* Generous Pension Contribution
* Life Assurance at 4x Salary
* Critical Illness Cover
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Work culture focused on innovative disruption


*Benefits may vary by location.*
**Our Workplace**
 While we prioritize a hybrid work environment, remote work may be considered for candidates located more than 30 miles from an office, based on role requirements for specialized skill sets. New hires will be invited to attend onboarding at one of our hubs within their first month. Teams also gather quarterly to support collaboration
   

  

*CoreWeave is an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and supportive workplace. All qualified applicants and candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information.*
**CoreWeave does not accept speculative CVs. Any unsolicited CVs received will be treated as the property of CoreWeave and your Terms & Conditions associated with the use of CVs will be considered null and void.**
**Any unsolicited CVs sent by your company to us – that is to say, in any situation where we have not directly engaged your company in writing to supply candidates for a specific vacancy – will be considered by us to be a “free gift”, leaving us liable for no fees whatsoever should we choose to contact the candidate directly and engage the candidate’s services, and will in no way establish any prior claim by your company to representation of that candidate should the candidate’s details also be submitted by any other party.**
**Export Control Compliance**
 This position requires access to export controlled information. To conform to U.S. Government export regulations applicable to that information, applicant must either be (A) a U.S. person, defined as a (i) U.S. citizen or national, (ii) U.S. lawful permanent resident (green card holder), (iii) refugee under 8 U.S.C.
   

  

* 1157, or (iv) asylee under 8 U.S.C.
* 1158, (B) eligible to access the export controlled information without a required export authorization, or (C) eligible and reasonably likely to obtain the required export authorization from the applicable U.S. government agency. CoreWeave may, for legitimate business reasons, decline to pursue any export licensing process.


***Updated privacy notice - UK and EU Job Applications***
*When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by CoreWeave UK Ltd. (“Controller”), which is located at*
*Phosphor (6th Floor), 133 Park Street, London, SE1 9EA*
*and can be contacted by emailing* 
*careers.eu@coreweave.com* 
*. Controller’s data protection officer can be contacted at* 
*privacy@coreweave.com* 
*. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Controller’s recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(f) of (i) Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation (“GDPR”) and (ii) the GDPR as it forms part of the laws of the UK (“UK GDPR”), as necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the Controller, which are the solicitation, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment. Your personal data will be shared with Greenhouse Software, Inc., a cloud services provider located in the United States of America and engaged by Controller to help manage its recruitment and hiring process on Controller’s behalf. With respect to transfers originating from the UK or the European Economic Area ("EEA") to a country outside the UK or the EEA, we implement the appropriate transfer mechanism(s) and other appropriate solutions to address cross-border transfers as required by applicable law. You may request a copy of the suitable mechanisms we have in place by contacting us at* 
*privacy@coreweave.com*
*Your personal data will be retained by Controller as long as Controller determines it is necessary to evaluate your application for employment. Where permitted by applicable law, we may also retain your personal data for a limited period after the recruitment process ends in order to consider you for future job opportunities, respond to legal claims, or comply with record-keeping obligations. Under the GDPR and the UK GDPR, you have the right to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified or erased, and to request that processing of your personal data be restricted. You also have the right to data portability. In addition, you may lodge a complaint with the relevant supervisory authority: (i) A list of Europe’s data protection authorities can be found* 
*here* 
*; and (ii) for the UK, this is the* 
*Information Commissioner's Office* 
*.*
*For additional information, please see our* 
*Privacy Policy* 
*.*

title: Backend Engineer - Subscriptions
description:
We are a team working on defining the premium and free value propositions, and are seeking a Backend Engineer to join us.
   

  

 We own a system to define the product features that all our free, mid-tier and premium products have. We are the central source of truth for all existing and new premium products and own datasets and APls that teams around us can use. We are working on new systems to control pricing and discount availability for our premium products. Besides this we also own a system for capping features (e.g. audiobook consumption, on-demand playback, and more).
   

  

 We are a mature team and we have a good mix of investigation and implementation work and a lot of opportunities to lead initiatives of all sorts of sizes and complexity. We are very fast-paced and have a culture of helping teams that we work with with what they need.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Build and deliver end-to-end backend solutions for our core systems, taking responsibility for the quality and maintainability of your code.
* Lead the implementation of well-defined projects within the squad, coordinating with other engineers to ensure the team successfully meets its goals.
* Contribute to the evolution of our squad's architecture by proposing and implementing improvements to our existing systems.
* Work with product managers and stakeholders to translate requirements into robust and scalable technical solutions.
* Take an active role in the operational health of our systems, including facilitating incident response and improving observability.
* Improve our team's engineering practices through thoughtful code reviews, clear documentation, and mentoring other engineers.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have a strong professional experience building and maintaining scalable backend services.
* You have a strong command of Java and experience with container orchestration using Kubernetes.
* You are proficient with cloud platforms (GCP preferred) and have hands-on experience with data systems like BigQuery and data processing pipelines (e.g., using Scio or similar frameworks).
* You are a dependable engineer who thrives on taking complex, multi-part projects from concept to completion with a high degree of autonomy.
* You are a strong collaborator who can effectively coordinate with peers to deliver on squad-level initiatives.
* You look beyond the ticket, understanding the business context of your work and making pragmatic technical decisions to match.
* You enjoy sharing your knowledge and find it rewarding to help other engineers on your team grow their skills.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: OT Solution Architect
description:
Har du erfarenhet av att designa och driftsätta nätverk i produktionskritiska miljöer? Brinner du för att arbeta nära kundens verksamhet och bidra till säker och robust kommunikation inom OT och industriell IT? Då vill vi träffa dig!
   

  

 Jag heter Michael Mothander och är Head of Cyber Security på Telia Cygate, en affärsnära expertorganisation inom Telia Company. Vi växer och söker nu en
 **OT Solution Architect** 
 som vill vara med och bygga framtidens säkra OT nätverk. Rollen kombinerar teknisk expertis, säkerhetsfokus och nära samarbete med våra kunder inom samhällsviktig verksamhet.
   

  

**Vad du kommer att göra i rollen:**
 I rollen som OT Solution Architect blir du en nyckelperson i att designa, driftsätta och underhålla nätverksinfrastruktur för industriella miljöer – med fokus på OT, säkerhet och tillgänglighet. Du arbetar nära både Telia Cygates experter och våra kunders drift- och IT/OT-organisationer för att säkerställa stabil och säker kommunikation i produktionskritiska miljöer. Du kommer att arbeta ute hos kund när det behövs men mestadels av arbetet sker ifrån vårt lokala kontor.
   

  

 Vi tror att vår förmåga inom nätverk, cybersäkerhet och OT, tillsammans med vår roll inom totalförsvaret, ger oss en unik position att skapa ett differentierat erbjudande till våra kunder.
   

  

* Designa och underhålla nätverksutrustning i OT-miljöer (switchar, routrar, brandväggar)
* Medverka i kund- och säljdialoger
* Felsöka och hantera allvarliga incidenter i produktionskritiska nätverk
* Ansvara för arkitektur, dokumentation, förändringar och driftrutiner
* Samarbeta med drift, IT och cybersäkerhetsteam
* Implementera remote access, övervakning, visibilitet och loggning i OT-nätverk


**För att lyckas i rollen:**
 Du är analytisk, lösningsorienterad och har hög säkerhetsmedvetenhet. Du trivs i komplexa miljöer där du får vara en brygga mellan IT och OT, och du är van att arbeta strukturerat även under press. Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att arbeta hos en systemintegratör där du har en gedigen kunskap inom nätverksteknik och IT säkerhet. Har du arbetat med OT/IoT ser vi det som ett starkt plus.
   

  

* Flera års erfarenhet av design av nätverkslösningar och/eller som pre-sale
* Erfarenhet av nätverkssäkerhet
* Kunskap om industriella protokoll
* Förståelse för OT-miljöer är ett plus
* God dokumentationsvana och strukturerat arbetssätt.
* Certifieringar inom nätverk eller säkerhet är meriterande (ex. Cisco, Fortinet eller motsvarande)
* Erfarenhet av industriella miljöer är meriterande
* Kunskap om relevanta standarder är meriterande
* Erfarenhet av industrispecifika nätverkstekniker är meriterande


**Varför Telia Cygate?**
 På Telia Cygate är vi inte bara experter på nätverk, säkerhet och olika slags moln – vi är också ett gäng som tycker att det ska vara kul att gå till jobbet! Som en del av Telia Company har vi styrkan att skapa verklig påverkan i stor skala, bidra till samhällsnytta och hjälpa våra kunder att navigera i digitaliseringens värld. Vi gör det alltid med värme, omtanke och ett leende. Här är det idéerna och våra olika perspektiv som gör oss starka, och tillsammans ser vi till att teknikens värld blir en plats där alla trivs – och där du hör hemma.
   

  

 Hos oss är din utveckling viktig. Vi uppmuntrar till kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och ser till att just du och dina intressen är i fokus. Vi vet att det är människorna som utgör vårt företag, och därför värdesätter vi glädje, kreativitet och olika perspektiv i allt vi gör.
   

  

 Välkommen att växa tillsammans med oss, där vi gör teknik mänsklig och skapar verklig påverkan!
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 När du börjar hos oss får du ett omfattande förmånspaket anpassat efter din lokala marknad, möjlighet till hybridarbete och mer. Du har också chans att få bonus baserat på din prestation och Telias resultat.
   

  

**Låter det intressant?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan senast 2026-01-11. Urval och vidare intervjuer kommer att ske efter jul och nyår.
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm, Göteborg eller Malmö
   

  

 Om du går vidare i processen kommer du att kontaktas av vår
 **Talent Acquisition Partner.** 
 Bakgrund- och referenskontroller ingår i processen.
   

  

 Har du några frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta gärna vår Talent Acquisition Partner på felicia.gardare@teliacompany.com
   

  

**Lika möjligheter för alla**
 På Telia värderar vi kompetens och utvecklingspotential. Vi främjar mångfald och ser till att varje individs behov tillgodoses, oavsett funktionsvariation, kön, ålder, nationalitet, sexuell läggning eller social bakgrund. Tillsammans skapar vi en inkluderande arbetsmiljö där din unikhet är vår styrka.
   

  

**Välkommen till Telia Cygate – Home of Experts**

title: Sr Revenue Operations Analyst
description:
**ABOUT SINCH** 




 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses - including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others - rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
 



 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
 



 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
 



**DESCRIPTION** 




 EMEA Revenue Operations team in Sinch is looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. This role will require a strong foundation in Salesforce, Excel, Tableau, Power BI as well as other advanced reporting tools, coupled with prior management consulting experience to drive data-driven insights, stakeholder engagement, and strategic decision-making across the EMEA region. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable intelligence to support business growth and efficiency for the region.
 



**In this role you'll make a significant impact by driving the activities in the following areas:** 




**Data Analysis & Reporting** 



* Extract, clean, and analyze large datasets from Salesforce, Excel, Tableau and other platforms.
* Develop interactive dashboards and visualizations in Excel, Tableau and Salesforce.
* Deliver regular and ad-hoc reports to senior management and business stakeholders.



**Business Insights & Strategy** 



* Translate complex data findings into clear business recommendations.
* Identify trends, opportunities, and risks to support regional business objectives.
* Partner with cross-functional teams to optimize processes and improve performance.



**Stakeholder Engagement & Consulting** 



* Act as a trusted advisor to stakeholders across the EMEA region.
* Leverage consulting experience to manage expectations, challenge assumptions, and align on data-driven decisions.
* Gather and translate business requirements into actionable data needs, collaborating closely with data engineering teams to design models and enable effective reporting and BI solutions.



**Data Governance & Best Practices** 



* Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and compliance with company standards.
* Promote data-driven decision-making across the organization.
* Drive adoption of dashboards and reporting tools within business teams.







**Key Tasks and Responsibilities:** 



* Maintain and optimize Tableau, Excel, Salesforce reports and dashboards for business needs.
* Design and automate Excel-based models for recurring analysis.
* Build advanced Tableau, Salesforce dashboards to support leadership decision-making.
* Provide performance metrics, KPIs, and business health reporting for EMEA.
* Partner with Sales, Finance, Marketing, Product and Operations teams on cross-regional projects.
* Support strategic initiatives by providing scenario modeling and forecasting.
* Deliver clear documentation and training for stakeholders using analytics tools.







**REQUIREMENTS** 




**Professional Experience** 



* 5-7 years in data analysis, business intelligence, or analytics consulting.
* Minimum of 2 years in management consulting or a similar advisory role.
* Strong focus on accuracy, detail, and precision.



**Technical Skills** 



* Advanced Salesforce reporting and data extraction.
* Proficiency in Excel (advanced formulas, pivot tables; macros preferred).
* Expertise in Tableau, Looker, and other visualization tools.
* Nice-to-have: experience with data warehouses (Snowflake) and data build tools (DBT).
* Ability to interpret complex datasets and transform them into actionable insights.



**Stakeholder & Communication Skills** 



* Proven ability to influence, collaborate, and communicate effectively with senior stakeholders.
* Skilled at presenting data in a clear and compelling way.



**Education & Languages** 



* Degree in Business, Economics, Data Analytics, or related field.
* English fluency required; additional EMEA languages are an advantage.







 Our corporate language is English,
 **please submit your application in English** 
 .
 



 At Sinch, we value learning, embrace change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we are not supporting relocation outside the EU at this time. Applicants must:
 


* Hold Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship.
* Have a valid Swedish work permit.







**OUR HIRING PROCESS** 




 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
 



 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Senior Azureutvecklare
description:
As of 2 September 2025, Vivicta, former Tietoevry Tech Services, now operates as a standalone company under our new brand. We’ve officially launched Vivicta, your trusted Nordic transformation partner, making everyday easier through technology. You can explore more about our brand and what we stand for at https://www.vivicta.com
   

  

 Ready to join us? Click ‘Apply’ and complete our short application form to get started. Prefer another option? Apply via LinkedIn to automatically populate your details using your profile.
   

  

 Är du en driven och engagerad integrationsutvecklare som brinner för att skapa smidiga och effektiva lösningar? Vill du vara en del av ett innovativt team på Nordens största Tech-företag? Då är det dig vi söker!
   

  

 Vi söker en integrationsutvecklare med erfarenhet inom Azure (gärna även Boomi) som vill bli en del av Vivicta. Vivicta driver företagsomfattande transformationer av kundernas affärsprocesser, applikationer och infrastruktur.
   

  

 I rollen blir du del av ett tvärvetenskapligt team som inkluderar experter inom Data Management, AI, GenAI, Cloud, Software Engineering, Security och Automation. Om du brinner för att använda teknik för att driva transformation och trivs i en samarbetsmiljö så ser vi framemot din ansökan!
   

  

**När du börjar på Vivicta som integrationsutvecklare kommer du att:**
* Designa och utveckla integrationslösningar.
* Arbeta nära våra kunder för att förstå deras behov och skapa skräddarsydda lösningar.
* Delta i hela utvecklingscykeln, från kravanalys till implementation och support.
* Samarbeta med andra utvecklare, arkitekter, förvaltare och tekniska experter för att säkerställa hög kvalitet och prestanda i våra lösningar.


**Vem vi söker**
* Du har minst 2 års erfarenhet av integrationsutveckling.
* Du har djupgående kunskaper inom Azure Integration Services (t.ex. Logic Apps, Service Bus, API Management).
* Du är lösningsorienterad och har en stark analytisk förmåga.
* Du är en lagspelare med god kommunikationsförmåga.


**Det är meriterande om du också har**
* Erfarenhet av Boomi eller liknande integrationsplattformar.


**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Vi erbjuder dig professionell tillväxt, meningsfulla projekt, öppen kultur och en enastående balans mellan arbete och privatliv! Vi erbjuder dig en möjlighet att skapa framtiden för en snabbt växande och viktig sektor. Vi tror att vår organisationskultur är en viktig del för att du ska bli framgångsrik. Vi tillhandahåller en flexibel hybrid arbetsmodell som en del av vår kultur och vårt sätt att arbeta. Slutligen tror vi också på nyfikenhet och konstant lärande som en livsstil där du behöver skola om dig varje dag när nya möjligheter dyker upp.
   

  

**Blev du inspirerad?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Bifoga ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande, så vi uppmanar dig att söka redan idag. Om du har några frågor angående denna roll, vänligen kontakta anställande chef, förnamn efternamn, anna.ryan@vivicta.com
   

  

 Hoppas vi hörs snart!
   

  

 Plats: Flexibel, hybrid. Resa till Stockholm ca 1 gång/månad kan förekomma.
   

  

*Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla slutkandidater.*
*Vivicta tackar nej till samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*

title: Staff Software Engineer - Content Experience Platform
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***








**Who We Are…**





 When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the
 *storytellers* 
 bringing our characters to life, the
 *creators* 
 bringing them to your living rooms and the
 *dreamers* 
 creating what’s next…
 









 From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.
 




  


 Warner Bros. has been entertaining audiences for more than 90 years through the world’s most-loved characters and franchises. Warner Bros. employs people all over the world in a wide variety of disciplines. We're always on the lookout for energetic, creative people to join our team.
 




  


**Your New Role...** 








 The Direct to Consumer (DTC) Group is a technology company within Warner Bros Discovery. We are building a global streaming video platform (OTT), and a suite of applications to support all of our network’s brands globally. We are building modern container-based micro-services operated on AWS. Our platform covers everything from search, content catalogue, video transcoding, personalization, to global subscriptions, and much more. We enable performant streaming experiences across connected TVs, web, mobile phones, tablets, and consoles for a large footprint of WBD owned streaming services (HBO Max, Discovery+, CNN, and others). This is a growing, global engineering group crucial to WBD’s future.
 







 We are hiring a Staff Software Engineer within the DTC Content Experience Platform. The team is responsible for aggregating, enabling, and serving the personalized Content Discovery experience within our DTC streaming video platforms through our Experience Services APIs. We ensure all client applications worldwide have seamless access to the latest and relevant content metadata, personalized browse experiences and curations, and presentational elements to deliver a best-in-class content discovery experience to our hundreds of millions of streaming users globally across our different streaming service platforms.
 



  


**Your Role Accountabilities...** 



* Shape the long-term technical direction of major workstreams in close partnership with Engineering peers, Product Managers, Technical Program Managers, and Designers.
* Lead system design and development of large, complex features and infrastructure, either in new domains or across multiple existing systems.
* Partner with other technical leaders to drive successful end-to-end delivery, from discovery and planning through execution and operations.
* Support the growth and development of engineers in your workstreams through coaching, design collaboration, and fostering technical excellence.
* Define and uphold standards for code quality, operational excellence, and reliable delivery across teams.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define MVPs, milestones, and product requirements that align engineering efforts with business outcomes.
* Drive architectural decisions that enable scalability, reliability, and adaptability for the future.
* Identify and address gaps, bottlenecks, or misalignments—working proactively to ensure long-term success for your team and the organization.



  


**Qualifications and Experience...** 



* At least 8 years of experience with deep expertise in Java or other JVM-based languages, including advanced language features, performance tuning, and designing systems for scale and reliability.
* Extensive experience building and operating cloud-native applications using Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS, including architecture design and production deployment.
* Strong command of distributed systems, microservice architectures, and synchronous /asynchronous communication patterns using technologies like gRPC and Kafka.
* Proven ability to design and evolve high-performance, low-latency APIs and backend systems that serve real-time, high-throughput workloads.
* Practical and architectural-level experience with persistence and caching technologies such as PostgreSQL, Redis, Elasticsearch, and Caffeine, including data modeling and performance optimization.
* Deep understanding of observability and tracing, with experience driving adoption of tools like OpenTelemetry, Jaeger, or Zipkin to improve system transparency and incident response.
* Experience defining and scaling infrastructure as code practices using Terraform, Helm, ArgoCD, and GitOps workflows.
* Ability to establish robust monitoring, alerting, and logging systems using tools such as Prometheus, CloudWatch, Kibana, and PagerDuty, and ensure teams operate systems with confidence.
* Familiarity with non-blocking, asynchronous, and reactive programming paradigms, including frameworks like Spring WebFlux or Vert.x, and when to apply them effectively.
* Comfortable evaluating, introducing, and scaling technical choices across multiple teams to drive engineering velocity and system robustness.



  


**Additional Information** 
  
 







 On June 9, 2025, Warner Bros. Discovery announced plans to separate into two publicly traded companies, Warner Bros. and Discovery Global, with an expected completion in mid-2026. For more details, including leadership appointments and information on individual brands, please visit our newsroom
 
 here
 
 . 
 







 Although you will be hired by Warner Bros. Discovery, upon the planned separation in 2026, your employment likely will transition to Warner Bros. Company. During this period of transformation, you’ll have an exciting opportunity to lay the foundation at one of the world’s premier entertainment brands.  
 



























  


**How We Get Things Done…**









 This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at
 












 www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/
 











  
 
 along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.
 








**Championing Inclusion at WBD**



 Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects a wide array of perspectives, backgrounds and experiences. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, regardless of sex, gender identity, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, disability or any other category protected by law.
 









 If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our
 
 accessibility page
 
 for instructions to submit your request.

title: SAC Solution Architect with a financial planning focus to Management Consulting, KPMG (Stockholm)
description:
Are you an experienced solution architect with deep expertise in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), passionate about financial planning and performance management and ready to deliver and shape transformative analytics solutions? Join KPMG’s Management Consulting and help leading organizations in Sweden shape the future of enterprise analytics!
   

  

**Your Role**
 We are seeking a SAC Solution Architect to join our Finance Transformation team in Stockholm. As part of our Management Consulting practice, you will collaborate with major Swedish corporations and organizations to design and deliver modern analytics solutions, drive digitalization, and support strategic decision-making.This role is a functional, business-driven position at the intersection of finance processes and modern technology.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to contribute to high-impact projects, work alongside senior stakeholders, and be part of a collaborative, high-performing, and purpose-driven team.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Oversee and execute SAC solution architecture, data modeling, and integrations of SAP and non-SAP environments
* Lead requirements workshops and process discussions with finance and business stakeholders
* Develop functional planning models, implement driver-based logic, and configure data flows to support accurate and efficient financial planning
* Together with business process experts design end-to-end SAC Planning solutions, including predictive scenarios and dashboards, to optimize business planning processes
* Drive governance, performance optimization, and best practices within analytics solutions
* Collaborate with technical teams to ensure accurate data integration and model performance
* Translate business needs into solution architecture, ensuring scalability and best-practice design. Partner with stakeholders to deliver scalable and robust analytics solutions
* Facilitate workshops to engage both business stakeholders and technical teams


 ,
   

  

**Relevant Experience And Knowledge**
* You have significant experience in business intelligence, analytics, or data warehousing, with at least 8 years in the field and a minimum of 3 years working directly with SAC
* You have strong understanding of FP&A, budgeting, forecasting, cost allocation, and performance management
* You have knowledge of planning best practices: scenario modelling, rolling forecasting, driver-based planning
* Basic knowledge in SAP BW, HANA Data Warehouse, Datasphere, and integration of complex systems
* You have demonstrated success in solution architecture, leadership of analytics initiatives and experience collaborating with cross-functional teams including finance, business, and technical stakeholders
* You have experience facilitating workshops with finance stakeholders and ability to translate business requirements into planning models, driver-based logic, workflows, and reporting structures


**Requirements**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Finance, Business, Engineering, or related field
* Minimum of 8 years’ experience in BI/Analytics/Data Warehousing, with at least 3 years in SAP Analytics Cloud
* Strong analytical and conceptual skills with the ability to design end-to-end planning processes
* Practical experience with SAC Planning or similar enterprise planning tools
* Strong business acumen and proven leadership in analytics projects
* Excellent communication and workshop facilitation skills
* Ability to operate cross-functionally across finance, business, and technical areas
* Fluency in English


**What We offer:**
* An exciting opportunity to work on different types of engagements across various industries
* An inspiring work environment where you are empowered to perform at your best
* An inclusive environment where diversity is one of our core foundations
* A flexible workplace, where work-life balance is a top priority
* Generous employee benefits package


 Want to make a difference together with us?
   

  

 Then you are warmly welcomed with your application. If you have any questions regarding the position, you are very welcome to contact our Head of Finance Transformation Victor Crona victor.crona@kpmg.se or responsible Talent Manager marie-louise.baath@kpmg.se or mobile +46 76 717 46 85.

title: Sales Development Representative - Belgian and Dutch markets
description:
**Be a Key Player in the Future of Telematics – Apply as a Sales Development Representative at ABAX!**
 Do you have a talent for building relationships, love talking to people, and enjoy opening doors to new opportunities? Then we have the perfect role for you!
   

  

 Our Stockholm office is expanding – and we’re now looking for an ambitious, results-driven
 **Sales Development Representative** 
 to strengthen our growth. In this role, you’ll be focusing on the
 **Belgian and Dutch markets** 
 , which means we’re looking for someone fluent in
 **Dutch or Flemish** 
 . You may already have experience in sales, or perhaps you’re at the start of your career and eager to develop in a role with great potential. With us, you’ll have the chance to grow alongside a successful team in a fast-moving and future-focused organisation.
   

  

**What does the role involve?**
 As a Sales Development Representative at ABAX, you’ll be the crucial first point of contact for our future customers. You’ll be the face of the company and play a central role in our sales journey. Your mission? To book high-quality meetings for our Account Executives, laying the foundation for strong customer relationships.
   

  

 You’ll be part of a passionate team where we support one another, celebrate successes, and work towards shared goals.
   

  

**Your responsibilities:**
* Prospect and identify new business opportunities – with the phone as your main tool.
* Book relevant meetings with the right decision-makers.
* Work closely with the sales team – you’re a key player in creating a first-class customer journey from the very first contact.
* Build your pipeline and work strategically to hit your targets.
* Work smart! Use our CRM tools, reporting systems, and training platform to work more effectively and achieve results faster. We give you the tools – you create the results!
* Drive our growth by booking meetings that lead to new customers.


**Who are you?**
 You’re an energetic person who sees opportunities where others see obstacles. You’re motivated by results, enjoy challenges, and are always looking to develop.
   

  

**We believe you:**
* Have experience in proactive sales or eager to learn.
* Are goal-oriented, structured, and self-driven.
* Communicate fluently in both Dutch and/or Flemish and English.
* Enjoy working in a team but are also confident in taking your initiative.
* Identify with our values: enthusiastic, customer-focused, innovative, and sustainable.


 Do you also have experience in SaaS, telematics, leasing, service sales, or similar? That’s a big plus – but not a requirement.
   

  

**What do we offer you?**
 At ABAX, you don’t just get a job – you get a career opportunity. Here, we value collaboration, innovation, and a joyful workplace.
   

  

 We offer:
   

  

* Comprehensive onboarding through ABAX School
* Competitive salary + bonus scheme
* Private healthcare and insurance
* An inspiring work environment in our modern office in Stockholm


 You’ll be working in a fast-growing international company – where no day is the same, and where your ideas and energy make a real difference.
   

  

**Background Checks & References:**
 Employment at ABAX depends on receiving satisfactory references.
   

  

 As part of our recruitment process, we carry out digital reference checks via RefApp, an online solution.
   

  

 Please note that a background check may also be conducted alongside the reference check.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities:**
 At ABAX, we are committed to creating an inclusive working environment for all our colleagues. This commitment also extends to ensuring our recruitment routines and processes are as inclusive as possible. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to join us and contribute to strengthening our focus on equality and diversity in the workplace.
   

  

**About ABAX**
 ABAX is a leading European telematics IoT platform offering connected mobility solutions for vehicle tracking, tool tracking, and equipment control. Our mission is to deliver mobility data insights that empower people to do more with less.
   

  

  

  

 With over 500,000 tracked assets and 40,000 customers, ABAX delivers reliable and powerful solutions for businesses relying on physical operations. Our advanced platform transforms customer needs into actionable insights and automated reporting, driving efficiency and operational excellence.
   

  

  

  

 We operate across Europe, with over 350 employees working from our facilities in Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, the Netherlands, Belgium, Poland, and the UK. Our Head Office is in Larvik, Norway.

title: Backend Engineer - Subscriptions
description:
We are a team working on defining the premium and free value propositions, and are seeking a Backend Engineer to join us.
   

  

 We own a system to define the product features that all our free, mid-tier and premium products have. We are the central source of truth for all existing and new premium products and own datasets and APls that teams around us can use. We are working on new systems to control pricing and discount availability for our premium products. Besides this we also own a system for capping features (e.g. audiobook consumption, on-demand playback, and more).
   

  

 We are a mature team and we have a good mix of investigation and implementation work and a lot of opportunities to lead initiatives of all sorts of sizes and complexity. We are very fast-paced and have a culture of helping teams that we work with with what they need.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Build and deliver end-to-end backend solutions for our core systems, taking responsibility for the quality and maintainability of your code.
* Lead the implementation of well-defined projects within the squad, coordinating with other engineers to ensure the team successfully meets its goals.
* Contribute to the evolution of our squad's architecture by proposing and implementing improvements to our existing systems.
* Work with product managers and stakeholders to translate requirements into robust and scalable technical solutions.
* Take an active role in the operational health of our systems, including facilitating incident response and improving observability.
* Improve our team's engineering practices through thoughtful code reviews, clear documentation, and mentoring other engineers.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have a strong professional experience building and maintaining scalable backend services.
* You have a strong command of Java and experience with container orchestration using Kubernetes.
* You are proficient with cloud platforms (GCP preferred) and have hands-on experience with data systems like BigQuery and data processing pipelines (e.g., using Scio or similar frameworks).
* You are a dependable engineer who thrives on taking complex, multi-part projects from concept to completion with a high degree of autonomy.
* You are a strong collaborator who can effectively coordinate with peers to deliver on squad-level initiatives.
* You look beyond the ticket, understanding the business context of your work and making pragmatic technical decisions to match.
* You enjoy sharing your knowledge and find it rewarding to help other engineers on your team grow their skills.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Data Engineer
description:
På B3 Indes förvandlar vi data till värdefulla insikter som driver förändring och innovation. Vi skapar lösningar inom AI, Business Intelligence, Data Science och Automation för att maximera värdet av data och stärka företags konkurrenskraft. Vår styrka ligger i att kombinera passion för AI och data med en stark laganda, där vi stöttar varandra och löser utmaningar tillsammans.
   

  

**Rollen inom Data Engineering på B3:**
 Hos oss får du chansen att jobba med några av Sveriges mest spännande kunder och projekt. Vad innebär det? Jo, att du får:
   

  

* Gräva i och tillgängliggöra data som inte bara hjälper våra kunder – utan kanske till och med gör världen lite bättre.
* Göra företag mer datadrivna och smartare genom att guida dem i rätt riktning.
* Designar, modellerar och utveckla datalager som bygger på ett eller flera olika källsystem.
* Bygga och implementera avancerade lösningar – och faktiskt se dem göra skillnad!


 Här handlar det inte bara om teknik – det handlar om att modellera, tillgängliggöra och förvalta flöden av data som kan skapa verklig förändring. Vi gillar att tänka stort, experimentera och lösa kluriga problem tillsammans. Och det bästa? Du får ett team av grymma kollegor att bolla idéer med, lära dig av och ha kul ihop med!
   

  

****Det är din passion för** 
 data och analys som gör skillnaden. Utöver det ser vi gärna:**
* Har du en relevant universitetsutbildning? Toppen! Har du kanske skaffat motsvarande kunskaper genom arbetslivserfarenhet? Det funkar lika bra!
* Minst 4 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet – vi letar efter någon som har hunnit samla på sig en del erfarenhet inom området.
* Flytande svenska och engelska – eftersom båda språken används dagligen i arbetet.
* Tidigare konsultroller är ett plus! Har du jobbat som konsult tidigare? Då är det en extra merit, men inget krav.


**Men framför allt...**
 Har du djup erfarenhet av rollen som Data Engineer? Fantastiskt – det är viktigt! Men vi lägger också stor vikt vid din förmåga att se helheten, skapa användbara lösningar men framför allt att du är nyfiken. Om du dessutom har erfarenhet av flera olika moderna ramverk och utvecklarverktyg för t.ex ETL/ELT-flöden, Databaser, Data Warehouse, DataLake, Datamodellering och DevOps – är det ett stort plus.
   

  

 Vi ser även gärna att du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat i en eller flera molnplattformar – Azure, AWS, GCP.
* Kanske har du också lite koll på någon av de andra vanligaste BI-verktygen (ex; Power BI eller Qlik)
* Snowflake, Databricks eller något datalager automationsverktyg (ex: TimeXtender eller Wade)
* Viss erfarenhet av att arbeta med arkitektur


**Varför välja B3 Indes?**
 💡
 **Utveckling & karriär** 
 – Väx i en entreprenörsdriven miljö där din kompetens får ta plats.
   

  

 🌿
 **Balans & välmående** 
 – Vi värnar om ditt välbefinnande med stöd för wellness och en flexibel vardag.
   

  

 🚀
 **Energi & gemenskap** 
 – Här präglas kulturen av öppenhet, nyfikenhet och en passion för att skapa något större – tillsammans.
   

  

 ❤️
 **Vi bryr oss – på riktigt** 
 – Vi engagerar oss i samhällsfrågor och samarbetar med initiativ som Suicide Zero, My Dream Now och Pink Programming för att göra skillnad även utanför arbetslivet.
   

  

**En arbetsplats som gör skillnad** 
 :
   

  

 Vi är stolta över att ha utsetts till ett av
 **Sveriges fem främsta karriärföretag 2025** 
 – en utmärkelse som speglar vår energi, nyfikenhet och vårt engagemang för att skapa en inkluderande och inspirerande arbetsplats. Här värdesätts olika perspektiv och idéer, och vi tror att det är just det som gör oss starkare.
   

  

 Hos oss får du friheten att styra över dina uppdrag, din arbetstid och din utveckling. Vi erbjuder
 **konkurrenskraftiga löner** 
 , flexibilitet att forma din vardag och en sund balans mellan jobb och fritid. Och vi vet att
 **gemenskap är minst lika viktigt som teknik** 
 – därför satsar vi på allt från konferensresor och sommarfester till sköna AW:s där vi kan släppa jobbet för en stund.
   

  

**Om B3 Consulting Group**
*B3 Consulting Group är ett expansivt konsultbolag med cirka 1000 medarbetare. Vi brinner för innovation och hjälper Sveriges ledande företag och organisationer att skapa framtidens möjligheter genom digital transformation. B3 finns på* 
 tolv orter i Sverige samt i Polen, med huvudkontor i Stockholm. Bolaget grundades 2003, är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm Small Cap och omsatte 1 141 MSEK 2023.
   

  

*Vi är stolta över vår prisbelönta företagskultur, där olikheter, erfarenheter och gemensam energi värdesätts. Som ett etiskt och transparent bolag strävar vi efter att ha en positiv påverkan på samhället, människor och miljön. Vi är även engagerade i* 
 Women in Tech och initiativ för att stärka AI-utbildning för kvinnor. 2024 utsågs vi till Årets Employer Branding-företag, och vår HR-chef vann titeln Årets HR-chef.
   

  

**Är du redo att bli en del av ett företag där din passion för AI och data kan göra skillnad? Läs mer om oss och våra möjligheter här!**
